definitions.definition: if you are attracted by something, it interests you and makes you want it; if you are attracted by somebody, you like or admire them
definitions.sensetop: be attracted by somebody/somethingattract somebody (to somebody/something)

examples.text: I had always been attracted by the idea of working abroad.
What first attracted me to her was her sense of humour.
She finds herself increasingly attracted to them and their lifestyle.

definitions.definition: to have a sexual or romantic interest in somebody

examples.text: I am not attracted to him at all.

definitions.definition: to make somebody/something come somewhere or take part in something

examples.text: Officials hope to attract more tourists to the area.
The new city is expected to attract investment worth £45 billion.
The exhibition has attracted thousands of visitors.
The warm damp air attracts a lot of mosquitoes.
Figure out how to continue to attract and retain businesses.

definitions.definition: to make people have a particular reaction

examples.text: This proposal has **attracted a lot of interest**.
His comments were bound to **attract criticism**.
She tried to **attract the attention** of the waiter.

definitions.definition: if a magnet or gravity attracts something, it makes it move towards it
used to say that people who are very different are often attracted to each other

wordOrigin: late Middle English: from Latin attract- ‘drawn near’, from the verb attrahere, from ad- ‘to’ + trahere ‘draw’.
